articles.title: $10 Kalshi Referral Code SYRACUSE updated in NY for St. John’s, Orange men’s basketball
articles.summary: Kalshi is offering a $10 referral bonus with code SYRACUSE, apparently targeting New York basketball fans ahead of St. John's and Syracuse men's basketball action. The timing suggests Kalshi wants to capture college hoops betting interest as March approaches, using regional team loyalty to drive new user acquisition in their key New York market.

articles.title: Polymarket Iran Bets Hit $529 Million as New Wallets Draw Notice
articles.summary: Polymarket's Iran-related betting markets have exploded to $529 million in volume, with a notable influx of new wallet addresses placing wagers. The surge signals either genuine geopolitical anxiety driving mainstream adoption or sophisticated actors using prediction markets to hedge real-world exposure to Middle East conflict risks.

articles.title: Polymarket defends its decision to allow betting on war as ‘invaluable’
articles.summary: Polymarket is pushing back against critics who question whether people should be able to bet on military conflicts, calling such markets "invaluable" for information gathering. The defense comes as prediction platforms face growing scrutiny over the ethics of monetizing human tragedy, a debate that could shape how regulators treat geopolitical betting markets going forward.

articles.title: What are prediction markets?
articles.summary: Prediction markets let people bet real money on the outcomes of future events, from elections to corporate earnings to whether aliens will be discovered by 2030. They're becoming the go-to source for forecasting everything that matters because putting your money where your mouth is produces brutally honest odds that beat traditional polls and expert predictions.

articles.title: Bitcoin Needs a Huge Rally to Hit $150,000 by December -- Are Polymarket's 12% Odds Too Low, Too High, or Just About Right?
articles.summary: Polymarket traders are giving Bitcoin just 12% odds of hitting $150,000 by year-end, despite the crypto's recent momentum and growing institutional adoption. The wide gap between bullish crypto predictions and actual betting odds creates a classic arbitrage opportunity for traders who think the market is either wildly overconfident or dangerously complacent.

articles.title: Are Prediction Markets Mirroring Crypto's Boom?
articles.summary: Prediction markets are experiencing explosive growth patterns that mirror crypto's meteoric rise, with trading volumes and user adoption spiking across major platforms. If the parallel holds, we're either witnessing the mainstreaming of prediction markets or setting up for a spectacular crash that could set the industry back years.

articles.title: Coinbase’s head of litigation says states are “gaslighting” on prediction markets
articles.summary: Coinbase's top lawyer is accusing state regulators of misleading the public about prediction markets, likely in response to ongoing legal battles over platforms like Kalshi and PredictIt. This signals that major crypto players are ready to fight state-level crackdowns, which could either accelerate nationwide legalization or trigger a messy patchwork of conflicting regulations.

articles.title: Betting on suffering: The moral crisis of prediction markets
articles.summary: Critics are attacking prediction markets for allowing bets on human tragedy and suffering, from assassination attempts to natural disasters. The controversy threatens regulatory crackdowns and mainstream adoption as lawmakers and ethicists question whether some events are simply too sensitive to commodify.

articles.title: The Prediction Market Debate Is Older Than You Think
articles.summary: Prediction markets aren't some Silicon Valley invention from the 2000s,economists and statisticians have been debating their merits and flaws for decades, if not centuries. Understanding this long history of skepticism and support helps explain why regulators still treat prediction markets like radioactive waste, despite mounting evidence of their forecasting power.

articles.title: Kalshi and Polymarket Are Economic Oracles
articles.summary: Prediction markets like Kalshi and Polymarket have evolved beyond entertainment betting into sophisticated economic forecasting tools that reveal real-time sentiment about everything from elections to inflation. Smart money is already using these platforms as leading indicators, making them essential reading for anyone trying to predict where markets and politics are heading next.

articles.title: Kalshi bets on Neal Katyal in prediction market cases
articles.summary: Kalshi has hired former U.S. Solicitor General Neal Katyal to represent them in their ongoing legal battles over which prediction markets they can operate. This signals Kalshi is preparing for major Supreme Court-level fights that could determine whether prediction markets become mainstream or remain heavily restricted.

articles.title: Trump declares election interference national emergency? ...
articles.summary: Trump appears poised to declare election interference a national emergency, potentially triggering sweeping executive powers to investigate and prosecute alleged voting irregularities. Markets betting on 2024 election outcomes and political prosecutions will swing hard on any emergency declaration, as it signals Trump plans to use federal resources to challenge election processes that don't favor him.
